you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1574 a-and today's date is May
22nd 2018 and the thought of the episode
is European banks are in trouble it will
spread like a disease let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
there seems to be two camps out there
one for cryptocurrency the other one for
precious metals and when I look at it I
believe one goes with the other and I
believe eventually what's going to
happen is they're going to support each
other as we move forward as we move
through the transition as we get rid of
the Fayette central bank currency it
will all change now the blockchain has
the potential to revolutionize how gold
and precious metals are manufactured and
delivered consider the journey of a gold
nugget and what it must go through and
the supply chain from when they mine it
to the end consumer it cuts through
several other industries and practices
including legal or regulatory of
financial manufacturing and retail each
of which might have its own ledger
system these Ledger's are vulnerable to
hacking fraud errors misinterpretations
they can be forged for example to
conceal how the metal or mineral was
sourced if they use blockchain
technology to handle the mining of gold
there's no hiding anything remember
it's a ledger system it's decentralized
it's a truth machine decentralization
guarantees complete transparency meaning
anyone along the supply chain can see
how when where the metal is produced and
who was involved in every step of the
way
so blockchain technology can be used for
precious metals from when they mine it
all the way to when it reaches the end
consumer
and this will give the industry a huge
shot of trust not to mention
dramatically increase efficiency
now many producers tech firms and entire
jurisdictions have already adopted or
planned to adopt blockchain technology
for this very reason we see I am gold a
Toronto based producer announced last
month that it partnered with tradewind
markets a fin tech firm that uses
blockchain technology to facilitate
digital gold trading and we can see that
blockchain can be used for finance
healthcare insurance energy and a lot
more and what we're seeing here is a
merging of the blockchain technology
with precious metals and like I said in
the beginning I believe these are gonna
go hand in hand and I believe the
blockchain is gonna be used for many
different things not just for currency
trade but for many other things because
it is a truth machine you can always
backtrack and find out what happened
compared to today that is very difficult
especially when you have a centralized
system where maybe a central bank is
controlling everything and there's no
transparency whatsoever you can't see
their books you can't see how everything
is run you can't see anything and with
this it allows everyone to see
everything so we can see that this could
be used for both and everything and I
believe this is where we're headed and
many individuals believe this is where
we're headed and I think eventually
what's going to happen this is going to
take over everything and those companies
that were doing business one way they're
going to move slowly over to blockchain
technology now the economy is
continually breaking down yes we're
going to be going through this
transition yes we have new technologies
yes we're going to be moving away from
the central bank eventually I think when
the people start to wake up and realize
that the central banks the corporate
media have been demonizing blockchain
cryptocurrencies and they start
realize what it is as more corporations
use it people then are gonna say whoa
wait a minute why are we using a central
bank why are we using a banking system
that has fraud that has corruption why
are we using a central bank that has no
transparency but right now the economy
is slowly dying and the central bankers
they've been doing everything possible
to keep the economy propped up and we
know a little bit what they've been
doing we know that they've been using
quantitative easing they we know that
they control the stock market we know
they've been creating bubbles but a lot
of the work behind the scenes that
they've been doing we just don't know
and I'm sure it's quite a bit this is
why they don't want anyone to audit what
they're doing but we see in the economy
more and more stores they're closing
down and this is the first sign of how
the economy starts to break apart you
start to see it in retail you started to
see it in restaurants you started to see
it in housing you see it everywhere
where the people are transacting
business every single day this is where
it breaks down first and then it spreads
to the stock market and everywhere else
and of course the stock market is
usually when everyone goes oh my god it
came down there must be something wrong
no there's been something wrong for
quite a while just that no one really
noticed it Sears right now they're
closing about 40 stores including 31
stores and 9k Mart's and this the
closing of the stores spans 24 states
including Arizona California Florida
Missouri Ohio and Minnesota and they're
closing a lot of stores they're having a
lot of troubles just like JC Penney and
many of the other stores and once again
they're saying well this has to do with
online and everything like that and if
it truly was online we would see
everyone taking their purchases and
purchasing these items online and we
would see online business doing much
much better than it is today
I mean it's doing well and of course
that's going to gain ground as time goes
on especially when we start introducing
crypto currencies and other payment
methods it's going to really sky
get but again you're dealing with
physical products you still have to get
the physical products to the people and
still people like to go to the stores
and get their physical products they
don't want to wait for them
yes delivery is getting a little bit
better but once again it's still
physical it still takes a day or two to
get your merchandise but we're seeing
many other stores they're hurt by what
is happening in the economy we see
Victoria's Secret's and pink this is
owned by Elle brands and they've been
struggling with growth and they're
saying this has nothing to do with the
retail apocalypse this has nothing to do
with that they just they've reached the
top of their growth chart and everything
is not going well for the stores they
don't know what to do and I think what's
happening is people or not purchasing
like they used to and they're holding
back now and they're saying you know
something we're not going to go out and
purchase we have a lot of credit card
debt we're not gonna use our cash and
you know what I can do without this is
what a lot of people start to do when
they lose their jobs when they lose
their jobs and they get a part-time job
when they're not making the same salary
as they were they cut back and this is
what we've been seeing we're seeing the
consumer cut back on their purchases
this is why retail is really hurting
right now
we see that the u.s. is shackled by a
huge amount of debt now the US
government reached a new milestone when
our country topped 21 trillion for the
first time the national debt right now
grows by an average of seventeen
thousand dollars every second more than
some people earn an entire year that's
only an average and during the past
eight months the national debt grew by
52,000 per second and the trend toward
bigger and higher spending is only
getting worse and it's not getting
better
the ratio of national debt to GDP is a
hundred and five percent larger than the
economy as a whole if we go back to 1981
the national debt comprised of a mere 31
percent of GDP we are not moving in the
right direction right now and the
Treasury Department has plans to borrow
another trillion this year an 84% jump
from last year and when it comes to
interest rates well we need to look at
LIBOR the benchmark interest rates used
by leading banks around the globe the
LIBOR rate is intrinsically tied to
government debt and the US has
approximately seven point five trillion
in LIBOR related debt alone individual
loan debts are 97 percent LIBOR related
50 percent of the corporate debt is tied
to LIBOR as interest rates rise it will
hurt individuals corporations they will
file bank you know chapter 11 bankruptcy
z' and we can see that they have
increased to seven-year highs and the
library is continually moving up and as
that moves up its going to get worse and
worse for the individual for
corporations and for governments and we
see right now that the foreign buyers of
Treasury bonds has been decreasing
foreign buyers currently hold about 40%
of US bonds or debt this is at a new low
since November of 2016
foreign investors have been on a
downward trend since its high of 55
percent in 2008 the combination of
reduced foreign demand and the need for
increased funding could spell disaster
for the US economy and we see that the
central bank they're getting ready to
raise interest rates once again here in
the United States the LIBOR rate is
rising very very quickly and this is a
complete and utter disaster but this is
the trajectory that we're headed in this
is being pushed in that direction to
actually crash the central banking
system everyone needs to understand that
this is not a people driven system this
is a system that the central bank's
created and convinced us over the many
many many years that this is a great
system we don't need to be
in this system this is their system
where they enslave us where we have to
pay taxes because we borrow the money
with interest attached they convinced us
over the many years to believe that this
is normal that when debt Rises
everything's great
you're prosperous when debt Rises and
that's why the corporate media is out
there always telling you well a lot of
people spent a lot of money and put it
on their credit cards debt is rising
that's good for the economy no it's not
as we can see in other countries it's
terrible for the economy
yes spending is good but not debt
spending because you spend that money
then you owe money with interest
attached and guess what you can't pay it
so this is a complete and utter disaster
for the United States for Canada
Australia Europe for all the private
Western Central Bank countries it cannot
be sustained it's impossible so how do
you get out of this system well you can
have all the states vote and say we do
not want the central bank anymore you
can go through the Congress they can
vote but do you think they're gonna vote
in that way at this point no the
corporate media the government officials
they're intertwined into the central
banking system this is why the central
banking system is lasted for such a long
time how else can you get rid of it well
you can crash their system and then say
we have to restart it and say since it
crashed we need to find out what the
central bank has been doing all this
time let's maybe audit them remember
they're taking care of the country we
should know what they're doing it's that
simple and the only way out right now is
to crash it and this is why it's being
pushed to the edge and it will
continually be pushed to the edge now
the central bank's they know their
system can't last that much longer they
understand their system has a lifespan
of 40 to 45 years maybe can maybe they
can stretch it a little bit longer but
that's it
and they know once the debt level
reaches a certain point in an interest
rates rise it's game over as you can see
the whole system's breaking down people
are living in an illusion right now if
they think this system is going to last
forever it doesn't go back throughout
history it's been the same system it's
been the central banking system there's
been pockets when we didn't have the
central bank the private western central
bank I should say but if you go back
throughout time you can see that their
system when they're in control it
doesn't last and we see that the
European banks right now they are in
trouble and there is one problem for the
euro that keeps on growing
that's the unresolved banking crisis in
Europe and it's not a small problem the
euro system in your bank balance sheet
total around 30 trillion euros in
January 2018 that is about two hundred
and ninety one percent of GDP European
banks are in trouble trouble for several
reasons first banking regulation has
become tighter after the financial
crisis second there are risks hidden in
banks balance sheets third low interest
rates have contributed to increase asset
prices stocks and bonds have increased
due to the monetary policy of the ECB
thereby leading to accounting profits
for banks monetary policy has thereby
artificially propped up banking profits
during the last years for according to
the ECB non-performing loans loans where
borrowers have fallen behind in their
payments amount to 759 billion euros
that is 30 percent of the bank's equity
when the interest rates increase in the
future banks will be confronted with
several difficulties and we see with the
LIBOR with the Fed continually
increasing rates they're gonna be faced
with this non-performing loans will
increase and zombie companies will go
bust banks long term low interest rate
loans will become more difficult to
refinance profitably asset prices will
fall leading to losses government
may get into trouble which they will
this will then spread to other banks
remember the derivatives are all tied
into the entire system as a result of
all this of all these losses banks will
be forced to restrict credits as their
equity shrinks this is where we get into
the credit crisis this is a no-win
situation central bankers understand
this why do you think they've been
keeping the interest rates so low it's
not because oh they want to benefit the
everyday person they want to make it
easier for the everyday person no
they're keeping their system together
long enough where they can move it to a
new system but they want it to be
controlled it won't look like it's
controlled but they're really
controlling it and they're gonna make it
seem like someone else cause this wasn't
them everything was going fine and this
is how they create the illusion where
they say everything is fine we've been
doing our job and then all of a sudden
you know these people did this or this
country did that or the president with
his policies did this but it had nothing
to do with the central bank and on the
other hand the Patriots Trump they're
pushing this economy to the edge of the
earth and they're gonna push it over and
crash it and they're gonna try to gain
the narrative go back to 1971 who are
the narrative back then oh we're running
out of oil you can't get oil right now
there's speculators in the market trying
to get gold so we're gonna have to come
off the gold standard is the central
bank they created an entire narrative to
convince you of why you needed to follow
along with what they wanted to do it's
going to be the same thing right now but
we have two sides who is going to tell
the story central bank's where they'll
say they blame it on someone else
because we're going to a new system and
this is why the entire system's crashing
where is it going to be the Patriots
saying it was the central bank we need
to audit them and this is where we are
right now but no matter what we're gonna
be going through a tree
this is what you need to be prepared and
ready for it listen everyone thanks a
lot for listening be well be safe and
especially be prepared thanks a lot
